dict.string:
# Checks if [[ -z "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" ]]; then echo 'Workflow is missing bundle identifier!' >&2 exit 1 fi
# Plist contents read -r -d '' plist_contents <<ENDPLIST <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd"> <plist version="1.0"> <dict> <key>Label</key> <string>${alfred_workflow_bundleid}</string> <key>ProgramArguments</key> <array> <string>/usr/bin/osascript</string> <string>-l</string> <string>JavaScript</string> <string>-e</string> <string> function run(argv) { try { const alfred = Application("com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred") if (alfred.running()) alfred.runTrigger(argv[1], { inWorkflow: argv[0] }) } catch { const fileManager = $.NSFileManager.defaultManager const plistFile = fileManager.homeDirectoryForCurrentUser.path.js + "/Library/LaunchAgents/" + argv[0] + ".plist" fileManager.removeItemAtPathError(plistFile, undefined) } } </string> <string>${alfred_workflow_bundleid}</string> <string>data_update_detected</string> </array> <key>WatchPaths</key> <array> <string>~/Library/Group Containers/2BUA8C4S2C.com.1password/Library/Application Support/1Password/Data/</string> </array> </dict> </plist> ENDPLIST
# Main readonly launchagents_dir="${HOME}/Library/LaunchAgents" readonly plist_file="${launchagents_dir}/${alfred_workflow_bundleid}.plist"
if [[ "${auto_refresh}" -eq 0 ]]; then # Exit early if plist does not exist [[ -f "${plist_file}" ]] || exit 0
# Uninstall agent launchctl bootout "gui/$(id -u "${USER}")" "${plist_file}" rm "${plist_file}" else # Exit early if plist exists [[ -f "${plist_file}" ]] && exit 0
# Install agent mkdir -p "${launchagents_dir}" echo "${plist_contents}" > "${plist_file}" launchctl bootstrap "gui/$(id -u "${USER}")" "${plist_file}" fi

readonly items_hash_file="${alfred_workflow_data}/items_hash.txt" readonly old_items_hash="$(/bin/cat "${items_hash_file}")" readonly new_items_hash="$(/usr/bin/sqlite3 "${HOME}/Library/Group Containers/2BUA8C4S2C.com.1password/Library/Application Support/1Password/Data/1password.sqlite" 'SELECT * FROM item_overviews;' | md5)"
[[ -n "${items_hash_file}" ]] || exit 1 [[ "${old_items_hash}" == "${new_items_hash}" ]] && exit 0
./1password.js 'data_update_detected'
Include or exclude vaults from results

[{"title":"Manage Vaults","arg":"manage_vaults","subtitle":"Include or exclude vaults from results"},{"title":"Manage Accounts","arg":"manage_accounts","subtitle":"Include or exclude accounts from results"},{"title":"Force Update Items","arg":"update_items","subtitle":"Rebuild Workflow data"},{"title":"Reset Workflow","arg":"reset_workflow","subtitle":"Delete Workflow data"}]

readonly file="${alfred_workflow_data}/users.json"
# If we detect active users if [[ -n "$(op account list)" ]]; then # Create users JSON if it does not exist [[ -f "${file}" ]] || ./1password.js 'write_user_json'
# Show self-updating users JSON ./1password.js 'print_user_json'
exit 0 fi
echo '{ "rerun": 0.1, "items": [{ "title": "Sign in and update items", "arg": "update_items" }] }'
Include or exclude accounts from results
Open 1Password and unlock it. Keep it running and try again.
To connect with 1Password, the CLI unlock has to be enabled in 1Password Preferences → Developer → Connect with 1Password CLI.

readonly file="${alfred_workflow_data}/items.json"
if [[ -f "${file}" ]]; then cat "${file}" exit 0 fi
# Disable 1Password 7 feature readonly prefs_file="${alfred_preferences}/preferences/local/${alfred_preferences_localhash}/features/1password/prefs.plist"
if [[ -f "${prefs_file}" ]]; then /usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Delete :enabled' "${prefs_file}" 2> /dev/null fi
echo '{ "rerun": 0.1, "items": [{ "variables": { "action": "update_items" }, "title": "Sign in and update items", "arg": "update_items", "icon": { "path": "composite_icon.png" } }] }'
To enable third-party integration, the 1Password command-line tool needs to be installed.

# Constants readonly user_ids=("${(f)$(./1password.js 'print_user_ids')}")
# Sign in for user_id in "${user_ids[@]}"; do op signin --account "${user_id}" done
# Update items list ./1password.js 'update_items'
# Verify items list if [[ "$(< "${alfred_workflow_data}/items.json")" == '{"items":[]}' ]]; then echo 'ERROR: Unable to get any items.' >&2 rm "${alfred_workflow_data}/"{items.json,vaults.json} exit 1 fi
# Create hash of items readonly items_hash_file="${alfred_workflow_data}/items_hash.txt" readonly new_items_hash="$(/usr/bin/sqlite3 "${HOME}/Library/Group Containers/2BUA8C4S2C.com.1password/Library/Application Support/1Password/Data/1password.sqlite" 'SELECT * FROM item_overviews;' | md5)"
mkdir -p "$(dirname "${items_hash_file}")" echo "${new_items_hash}" > "${items_hash_file}"
Result will be copied to the clipboard

echo '### Workflow version' /usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Print :version' info.plist
echo echo '### Alfred version' /usr/bin/osascript -e 'tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to return version'
echo echo '### macOS version' /usr/bin/sw_vers -productVersion
echo echo '### Architecture' /usr/bin/arch echo
echo echo '### Preferences'
if [[ -f 'prefs.plist' ]]; then /usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Print' prefs.plist else echo 'Default' fi
echo echo '### 1Password version' /usr/bin/osascript -e 'tell application id "com.1password.1password" to return version' /usr/bin/osascript -e 'tell application id "com.agilebits.onepassword7" to return version'
echo echo '### op version'
if hash 'op' 2> /dev/null; then op --version else echo 'NOT installed' fi
echo echo '### Launchd job'
if launchctl list | grep -q "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}"; then echo -n 'Loaded: ' launchctl list | grep "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" else echo 'NOT loaded' fi
if [[ -f "${HOME}/Library/LaunchAgents/${alfred_workflow_bundleid}.plist" ]]; then echo 'Installed' else echo 'NOT installed' fi
A diagnostic has been copied to your clipboard. Please include it when describing the issue.

## Setup
[Install the 1Password CLI](https://1password.com/downloads/command-line/) and turn on the integration in 1Password Preferences → Developer → Connect with 1Password CLI.
![1Password preferences](images/about/1password_preferences.png)
## Usage
Interact with your 1Password items via the `1p` keyword.
![Alfred search for 1p](images/about/1p.png)
* <kbd>↩</kbd> Open and Fill. * <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> View in 1Password. * <kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Copy Username. * <kbd>⌃</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Copy Password. * <kbd>⇧</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Copy One-Time Password
Uncommon but useful actions, such as toggling vaults, can be accessed with `:1pextras`.
![Alfred search for :1pextras](images/about/1pextras.png)
![Results for managing vaults](images/about/vaults.png)
A [Fallback Search](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/default-results/fallback-searches/) is included.
To report a problem, run `!1pdiagnostic`.
Open and fill in web browser
Add parameter to URL for open and fill
Actions to perform when pressing modifier keys. Changes come into effect on next cache update.
Truncate website address to the hostname
Check for 1Password modifications and offer to update
